title: Temporary halt on dispatching Sri Lankans to Israel due to tension
byline: The dispatch of Sri Lankans for work in Israel had come to a temporary halt because of tension flaring up in the Middle-East with Iran launching a barrage of ballistic missile attacks on the Israeli territory in retaliation, an official said.

title: Maithri leaves SLFP in CBK’s hands
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena is reported to have requested Ms. Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga to take charge of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) and rebuild it.

title: De Silva rues misses, confident about next WTC cycle
byline: Taking inspiration from South Africa’s triumph at Lord’s, the Sri Lanka skipper is eyeing a similar victory for his side in the new World Test Championship cycle.

title: 17th suspect remanded over Ganemulla Sanjeewa’s murder
byline: Sugath Abeysinghe, the 17th suspect in the murder of Ganemulla Sanjeewa, was ordered to be remanded till June 20 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali.

title: Current programme undertaken with IMF will be final: President
byline: Sri Lanka aims to make the ongoing Extended Fund Facility of the International Fund Facility (IMF) the final programme undertaken with the IMF’s Extended Fund Facility, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: CSE decline continues as geopolitical tensions intensify
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) ended the day on a negative note, marking its second consecutive session of decline, as investor sentiment remained weighed down by escalating geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.

title: Sajith slams CMC over irregular leadership appointment
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa raised concerns over how the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) recently appointed its leadership, saying it was done by ignoring proper rules and guidelines.

title: Govt suspends Israel employment amid tensions
byline: The government has temporarily suspended the deployment of Sri Lankans for employment in Israel due to the ongoing conflict between Israel and Iran, Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment Deputy Minister Arun Hemachandra said.

title: 50mm rainfall forecast over next 36 hours: Meteorology Department
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a weather advisory forecasting intermittent showers in several parts of the country over the next 36 hours, with the possibility of heavy rainfall in certain areas.

title: Attorney General to raise objections against FR petitions challenging legality of Sri Lanka-India MoUs
byline: The Attorney General’s Department today informed the Supreme Court that it expects to file objections to two Fundamental Rights petitions filed challenging the legality of the recently signed Memoranda of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and India.

title: Chemical leak reported at Jayewardenepura Medical Faculty
byline: A chemical leak was reported this morning at the Faculty of Medical Sciences, University of Sri Jayewardenepura, prompting swift action from emergency services.

title: Sri Lankans can enter Israel via Jordan, Egypt: Ambassador
byline: Sri Lankans wishing to travel to Israel or return from Israel to Sri Lanka can obtain short-term visas at border crossings near the city of Eilat and enter Israel via neighboring countries, Sri Lankan Ambassador to Israel Nimal Bandara said.

title: Investigators find cockpit voice recorder from crashed Air India flight
byline: Investigators have recovered the cockpit voice recorder (CVR) from the crashed Air India flight, a key step in uncovering what caused last week’s deadly accident.

title: WhatsApp hotline to report abuse of elders
byline: The Social Security and Community Empowerment Ministry has introduced a dedicated WhatsApp number to report cases of abuse against adults, particularly elderly individuals neglected by their children.

title: Batticaloa medical doctor arrested for selling psychoactive drugs to youth
byline: A medical doctor who was running a dispensary in the Kiran area of Batticaloa was arrested for allegedly selling psychoactive drugs to youths.

title: Dr. Gita Gopinath meets President Dissanayake and CBSL Governor
byline: First Deputy Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) Dr. Gita Gopinath met with President Anura Dissanayake and Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe in Colombo today for high-level discussions on the country’s economic reform efforts.

title: New domestic airline gains AOC for Colombo–Jaffna passenger operations
byline: David Peiris Aviation (Pvt) Ltd, a newly established domestic airline and a subsidiary of the David Peiris Group, has officially received its Aircraft Operator Certificate (AOC) and operations specifications (Ops-Specs) from the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) to operate scheduled domestic passenger flights after obtaining the Airline License.

title: Air India Dreamliner returns to Hong Kong after technical issue mid-air
byline: An Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner plane bound for New Delhi returned to its origin of Hong Kong as a precautionary measure on Monday after a technical issue was suspected mid-air, the latest incident affecting the airline in recent days.

title: Colombo mayoral vote unfair, alleges SJB’s Riza Zarook
byline: Defeated Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) mayoral candidate Riza Zarook has accused the Commissioner of the Department of Local Government for the Western Province of acting unfairly during the election to appoint the new Mayor of Colombo held this morning.

title: SJB suspends six of its members in Dambulla Pradeshiya Sabha
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) General Secretary Ranjit Madumma Bandara announced today that the party membership of six members  in Dambulla Pradeshiya Sabha have been suspended for going against the party decision in electing the chairman.

title: Trump administration weighs adding 36 countries to travel ban, memo says
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration is considering significantly expanding its travel restrictions by potentially banning citizens of 36 additional countries from entering the United States, according to an internal State Department cable seen by Reuters.

title: Hemantha Kumara elected Deputy Mayor of CMC
byline: Hemantha Kumara of the National People’s Power (NPP) was proposed as the Deputy Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council and was elected unopposed.

title: Vraie Cally Balthazaar elected Colombo Mayor
byline: Vraie Cally Balthazaar of the National People’s Power (NPP) has been elected as the new Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council following a secret ballot held this morning.

title: Secret vote underway to elect Colombo Mayor
byline: A secret vote is currently underway to elect the Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: Lufthansa flight makes u-turn mid-air over bomb threat, denied Hyderabad landing
byline: A Lufthansa flight bound for Hyderabad was forced to make a U-turn and landed back at Frankfurt Airport on Sunday evening after passengers were informed that it had not received “permission to land” in India.

title: Tensions flare at Colombo Municipal Council’s first sitting
byline: The newly elected Colombo Municipal Council convened for its inaugural session this morning (June 16) at the Town Hall following the Local Government (LG) elections held on May 6.

title: Assets of 88 crime and fraud suspects seized
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have frozen the assets of 88 individuals linked to organized crime and financial fraud.

title: Trump told Israel not to kill Iran’s supreme leader - report
byline: US President Donald Trump rejected a plan by Israel to kill Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, three US officials have told BBC’s US partner CBS News.

title: Sri Lankan economy to be hit badly if Israel - Iran tension escalates
byline: Sri Lanka is closely observing the current development of tension in the Middle-East since instability in the region involves greater implications for the country’s economy recovering from the crisis, a source from the Foreign Ministry said.

title: Govt. authorities boycott National Tax Week awareness programme
byline: A host of senior public officials including that of the Ministry of Finance have boycotted an awareness programme organized in line with the National Tax Week, as a top liquor company said to have sponsored the event had promoted its products  during the event, the Daily Mirror learns.
